body:
Hi,

The paper you're looking for can be "HOW MUCH ENERGY DO TOPLIGHTING
STRATEGIES SAVE?".

Available on http://www.lrc.rpi.edu/programs/daylighting/index.asp

Nicolas Roy
VELUX A/S
Daylight Energy and Indoor Climate
nicolas.roy@velux.com

















"Ramana Koti" <ramana.koti@gmail.com>
Sent by: radiance-general-bounces@radiance-online.org
26-08-2008 23:10
Please respond to
Radiance general discussion <radiance-general@radiance-online.org>

To
bldg-sim@lists.onebuilding.org, "Radiance general discussion"
<radiance-general@radiance-online.org>
cc

Subject
[Radiance-general] daylighting and energy performance






Dear all,

I was once in a presentation by Prof Martin Moeck that was a comparative
study of energy performances of various daylighting strategies. I vaguely
remember simple skylights like in Walmart performing better than roof
monitors with louvers or something to that effect.

I don't even know if there is a paper written up on the subject matter. I
do not have Prof Moeck's current contact information so I'm hoping to find
him or someone else who can help through this email.

Thanks,

RAMANA KOTI Assoc. ASHRAE LEED? AP
Sustainable Building Analyst

ELEMENTS division of BNIM architects
106 West 14th Street Suite 200
Kansas City Missouri 64105

d 816.783.1635 f 816.783.1501
bnim.com | elements.bnim.com
